# normalizeAdjacentTextNodesPreservingCDATA(_:)

**Instance Method**

Coalesces adjacent text nodes of the receiver that you have explicitly added, optionally including CDATA sections.

## Declaration

```swift
func normalizeAdjacentTextNodesPreservingCDATA(_ preserve: Bool)
```

## Parameters

- **preserve**: [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if CDATA sections are left alone as text nodes, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] otherwise.

## Discussion

A text node with a value of an empty string is removed. When you process an input source of XML, adjacent text nodes are automatically normalized. You should invoke this method (with `preserve` as [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]) before using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode] methods [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/objects(forXQuery:constants:)] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/nodes(forXPath:)].

## Manipulating Child Elements

- **addChild(_:)**: Adds a child node at the end of the receiver’s current list of children.
- **insertChild(_:at:)**: Inserts a new child node at a specified location in the receiver’s list of child nodes.
- **insertChildren(_:at:)**: Inserts an array of child nodes at a specified location in the receiver’s list of children.
- **removeChild(at:)**: Removes the child node of the receiver identified by a given index.
- **replaceChild(at:with:)**: Replaces a child node at a specified location with another child node.
- **setChildren(_:)**: Sets all child nodes of the receiver at once, replacing any existing children.
